00035 #ifndef __CVMX_BOOT_VECTOR_H__
00036 #define __CVMX_BOOT_VECTOR_H__
00037 
00038 #ifndef __ASSEMBLY__
00039 
00040 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00041 #include <asm/octeon/octeon.h>
00042 #else
00043 #include "cvmx.h"
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 #endif /* __ASSEMBLY__ */
00047 /*
00048  * The boot vector table is made up of an array of 1024 elements of
00049  * struct cvmx_boot_vector_element.  There is one entry for each
00050  * possible MIPS CPUNum, indexed by the CPUNum.
00051  *
00052  * Once cvmx_boot_vector_get() returns a non-NULL value (indicating
00053  * success), NMI to a core will cause execution to transfer to the
00054  * target_ptr location for that core's entry in the vector table.
00055  *
00056  * The struct cvmx_boot_vector_element fields app0, app1, and app2 can
00057  * be used by the application that has set the target_ptr in any
00058  * application specific manner, they are not touched by the vectoring
00059  * code.
00060  *
00061  * The boot vector code clobbers the CP0_DESAVE register, and on
00062  * OCTEON II and later CPUs also clobbers CP0_KScratch2.  All GP
00063  * registers are preserved, except on pre-OCTEON II CPUs, where k1 is
00064  * clobbered.
00065  *
00066  */
00067 
00068 
00069 /*
00070  * Applications install the boot bus code in cvmx-boot-vector.c, which
00071  * uses this magic:
00072  */
00073 
00074 #define OCTEON_BOOT_MOVEABLE_MAGIC1_RAW 0xdb00110ad358eacd
00075 
00076 #ifdef __ASSEMBLY__
00077 #define OCTEON_BOOT_MOVEABLE_MAGIC1 OCTEON_BOOT_MOVEABLE_MAGIC1_RAW
00078 #else
00079 
00080 #define __CVMX_BOOT_VECTOR_PASTE1(_S) _S ## ull
00081 #define __CVMX_BOOT_VECTOR_PASTE(_S) __CVMX_BOOT_VECTOR_PASTE1(_S)
00082 #define OCTEON_BOOT_MOVEABLE_MAGIC1  __CVMX_BOOT_VECTOR_PASTE(OCTEON_BOOT_MOVEABLE_MAGIC1_RAW)
00083 
00084 struct cvmx_boot_vector_element {
00085     /* kseg0 or xkphys address of target code. */
00086     uint64_t target_ptr;
00087     /* Three application specific arguments. */
00088     uint64_t app0;
00089     uint64_t app1;
00090     uint64_t app2;
00091 };
00092 
00093 struct cvmx_boot_vector_element *cvmx_boot_vector_get(void);
00094 
00095 #endif /* __ASSEMBLY__ */
00096 #endif /* __CVMX_BOOT_VECTOR_H__ */
